#About me

<img src="images/image.jpg" style="width:75%">

_Education_
------------------------------------------------------------------------


Maya Spaur is a PhD student in the Environmental Health Sciences department at Columbia Mailman School of Public Health, located in New York, NY.

She completed her Master of Science (ScM) in Environmental Health & Engineering at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health in Baltimore, MD, in 2019. She has a Certificate in Risk Sciences & Public Policy from JHSPH, as well as a Certificate in Quantitative Microbial Risk Assessment (QMRA) from the QMRA Interdisciplinary Instructional Institute.

She completed a B.S. in Environmental Science & Technology with a concentration in Environmental Health, and a B.A. in Government & Politics, at the University of Maryland in College Park, MD, in 2017.   

_Experience_
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Maya worked as a Research Assistant for the environmental microbiology laboratory of Dr. Meghan Frost Davis, at JHSPH, from September 2017 - May 2019. She also worked as an Extern for Earthjustice from October 2018 - June 2019. Maya worked as a Teaching Assistant for the Risk Sciences & Public Policy series during the 2018 - 2019 academic year at JHSPH. Maya also worked as a Summer Fellow for Dr. Mary Ward at the National Cancer Institute, during the summers of 2018 and 2019.

Prior to graduate school, Maya worked as a Field Technician for the Maryland Department of Agriculture Mosquito Control; as a Hollings Scholar intern for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration; and as a Research Assistant and Surveyor for Dr. Paul Leisnham in the department of Environmental Science & Technology at UMD.
